contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kikuma'''|菊間町|Kikuma-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Ochi District, Ehime|Ochi District]], [[Ehime Prefecture|Ehime]], [[Japan]]. On January 16, 2005 Kikuma, along with the towns of [[Hakata, Ehime|Hakata]], [[Kamiura, Ehime|Kamiura]], [[Miyakubo, Ehime|Miyakubo]], [[Namikata, Ehime|Namikata]], [[Ōmishima, Ehime|Ōmishima]], [[Ōnishi, Ehime|Ōnishi]], [[Tamagawa, Ehime|Tamagawa]] and [[Yoshiumi, Ehime|Yoshiumi]], and the villages of [[Asakura, Ehime|Asakura]] and [[Sekizen, Ehime|Sekizen]], all from [[Ochi District, Ehime|Ochi District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Imabari, Ehime|Imabari]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 7,342 and a [[population density|density]] of 198.59 per km². The total area was 36.97 km². ==External links== *[http://www.city.imabari.ehime.jp/ Official website of Imabari] in Japanese [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ehime Prefecture]] {{Ehime-geo-stub}}
